elements.title: Bertha Acarapi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in being hired as a newscaster for ATB, Bertha Acarapi (pictured) became one of Bolivia's first high-profile chola indigenous presenters?

elements.title: Boost! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Boost! won a temporary restraining order against Mead Johnson, after claiming it had infringed on their trademarks?

elements.title: Mariano Santos Mateo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Peruvian Civil Guard officer Mariano Santos Mateo was nicknamed the Brave Man of Tarapacá because he captured a banner of a Chilean military unit during the Battle of Tarapacá?

elements.title: Oglethorpe County High School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oglethorpe County High School worked with the University of Georgia to bring their dropout rate from 65 dropouts in 1985–86 to just 4 in 1987–88?

elements.title: Should've Said No (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Taylor Swift said she wrote "Should've Said No" to address her "dramatic and crazy" experience?

elements.title: a 1982 legal decision (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that until a 1982 legal decision, women were not permitted to stand at the bar at El Vino in London?

elements.title: OPTi Inc. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that OPTi Inc. won a patent suit against Apple for unauthorized use of "predictive snooping" technology?

elements.title: Temple of Humanity (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the "Temple of Humanity" hosted underwear companies?
